images.summary: This site plan provides a detailed overview of the project area, highlighting existing structures such as the EX CBMH, EX CURB, and EX COKE BUILDING, along with proposed modifications like the new gate chamber and access hatch. The plan includes a key plan for orientation, with the area of work marked. It specifies the installation of a new gate chamber as per OPSD 1101.012 and a new access hatch with a top grade of approximately 210.658. Contractors are instructed to inspect and confirm the location and cover of storage tanks and report findings to SPH Engineering. The plan also notes that areas shown are approximate and subject to final confirmation on site. This sheet is essential for understanding the overall scope and integration of the storm tank access hatch within the site.

images.summary: This site plan outlines the overall layout of the project area, including existing conditions and proposed access points for the storm tank access hatch. It highlights key areas for construction and access, such as the EX CBMH, EX CURB, and EX COKE BUILDING. The plan includes a key plan for orientation and specifies the installation of a new gate chamber and access hatch. Contractors are instructed to inspect and confirm the location and cover of storage tanks, with findings to be reported to SPH Engineering. The plan notes that areas shown are approximate and subject to final confirmation on site. This sheet is essential for understanding the spatial arrangement and integration of new structures within the existing site.

images.summary: This plan view shows the layout for a storm tank access hatch, including dimensions and reinforcement details. The plan specifies a 32 MPa concrete slab reinforced with 20M bars at 6 inches on center, both ways top and bottom, with 2 inches of cover at the top and sides and 3 inches at the bottom. The slab is designed to accommodate existing CMP storage pipes with diameters of 3600mm and 1200mm. The plan includes a callout to see detail 4/S2 for further information. Dimensions provided include 9'-0" and 12'-0" for the slab, and 8'-8" for the chute. This view is essential for understanding the structural components necessary for the installation of the storm tank access hatch.

The tank is 8 feet tall with a 3-foot thick concrete slab above it. The drawing specifies a minimum of 6 inches of compacted Granular A beneath the tank. The existing storm-water storage tank is made of aluminized corrugated steel pipe (CSP) with a diameter of 11'-9-3/4" (3600mm). The elevation includes a locked lid by others and a chute with a wall thickness of 4.2mm. The drawing is labeled as 'Front Elevation' with a scale of 3/8" = 1'-0" and is referenced as 4/S1.

images.summary: This section view details the valve chamber, labeled as Valve Chamber Section A. The chamber includes a chimney cap, access chimney, and concrete rings to adjust the manhole cover to the finished grade. A ladder is provided with the precast structure, and the chamber cap is shown. The valve chamber dimensions include a height of 7'-10 1/2" and a width of 3'-11 1/4". The approximate grade is +/- 210.950, and the invert is at 206.652. The drawing specifies that the frame and cover must meet OPSD 401.010 standards. The contractor is required to field confirm and anchor to the precast as per manufacturer directions. The scale is 1/2" = 1'-0".

The approximate grade is set at +/- 210.950, with the valve box extending to the top and the contractor responsible for supplying the valve key. The frame and cover must meet OPSD 401.010 standards. The approximate grade is set at +/- 210.950, with the valve key extending to the top of the chamber. The contractor is instructed to parge and seal around the valve, and the frame and cover must meet OPSD 401.010 standards. The contractor is also required to field confirm dimensions. images.text_verbatim:
ITEM NO. PART NUMBER
1 WALL
2 1200mm-CMP__68-13-2
3 GROUT
4 GEN2-SG1200-48-UO-WM-SC
Designed and FEA tested to meet strength and leakage standards with AWWA 561-14
Each manual operator shall be designed to operate the gate under specified seating and unseating heads by using a maximum effort of 80 lbs (356 N) on the crank or handwheel, and shall be able to withstand, without effort of 80 lbs (356 N).
Gate and Seal Design exceeds the AWWA S561-14 performance criteria and is well below the allowed 1.25 l/min/m of sealing perimeter.
INSTALLATION NOTES: Frame Assembly, Pedestal, Wall Brace, Stem & Operator must be installed flat, straight and plumb. Shim and brace as required. See operation and maintenance manual for additional installation information.
Design Seating Head = 5m
Design Unseating Head = 5m
Design Operating Head = 5m
Gates can be designed to meet a higher head if required.
images.summary: This detail view focuses on the Echelon Environmental storm gate, highlighting components such as the wall, 1200mm-CMP, grout, and GEN2-SG1200-48-UO-WM-SC. The gate is designed and FEA tested to meet AWWA 561-14 standards for strength and leakage. The manual operator is specified to operate under seating and unseating heads with a maximum effort of 80 lbs (356 N). The gate and seal design exceeds performance criteria, ensuring leakage is below 1.25 l/min/m. Installation notes emphasize the need for flat, straight, and plumb installation of the frame assembly, pedestal, wall brace, stem, and operator. The design seating, unseating, and operating heads are all set at 5m, with the option to design for higher heads if needed.

This detail view shows the front view of the Echelon Environmental storm gate, featuring a 1200mm diameter opening. The overall height of the gate is 120 inches [3048 mm], with a width of 58 inches [1473 mm] and a depth of 16 inches [406 mm]. The detailed dimensions are crucial for ensuring the proper fit and integration of the storm gate within the storm tank access system.

This section view, labeled as Section A-A, provides a detailed cross-section of the Echelon Environmental storm gate. The gate features a 1200mm diameter opening, with an overall height of 120 inches [3048 mm]. The section shows a depth of 7.688 inches [195 mm] at the top and 2 inches [51 mm] at the bottom. The diameter of the outer frame is Ø52.5 inches [1334 mm], and the width is 58 inches [1473 mm]. These dimensions are essential for ensuring the correct installation and integration of the storm gate within the storm tank access system.

images.location: Site – Echelon Environmental storm gate components
images.text_verbatim:
ITEM NO. PART NUMBER QTY
1 WALL 1
2 1200mm-CMP_68-13-2 1
3 GROUT 1
4 GEN2-SG1200-48-UO-WM-SC 1

Designed and FEA tested to meet strength and leakage standards compliant with AWWA 561-14

Each manual operator shall be designed to operate the gate under the maximum specified seating and unseating heads by using a maximum effort of 40 lbs (178 N) on the crank or handwheel, and shall be able to withstand, without damage, an effort of 80 lbs (356 N).

Gate and Seal Design exceeds the AWWA C561-14 performance criteria. Leakage is well below the allowed 1.25 l/min/m of sealing perimeter.

INSTALLATION NOTES: Frame Assembly, Pedestal, Wall Brace, Stem Guides and Operator must be installed flat, straight and plumb. Shim and brace as necessary. See operation and maintenance manual for additional installation information.

Design Seating Head = 5m
Design Unseating Head = 5m
Design Operating Head = 5m
Gates can be designed to meet a higher head if required.
images.summary: This image shows a part list and installation notes for the Echelon Environmental storm gate. The part list includes four items: WALL, 1200mm-CMP_68-13-2, GROUT, and GEN2-SG1200-48-UO-WM-SC, each with a quantity of 1. The components are designed and FEA tested to meet AWWA 561-14 standards. The manual operator is specified to operate under maximum seating and unseating heads with a maximum effort of 40 lbs (178 N) and withstand an effort of 80 lbs (356 N). The gate and seal design exceed AWWA C561-14 performance criteria, with leakage well below 1.25 l/min/m of sealing perimeter. Installation notes emphasize the need for flat, straight, and plumb installation of the frame assembly, pedestal, wall brace, stem guides, and operator. The design seating, unseating, and operating heads are all specified as 5 meters, with the potential for higher head design if required. This detailed information ensures compliance with design and safety standards for accurate installation and integration within the storm tank access system.
